channel.title: Remixing popular songs
channel.description: I was thinking of making a remix of Khalids location and mix it up with future bass and use The songs vocals + vocal chops of The vocals on drop.I have Great ideas about remixes.But before starting anything.I would just like to ask.Can i really make a remix of any song i want to without having legal issues?Probably not but i wanted to be sure

item.title: Remixing popular songs
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
I posted this in another thread, but it’s also possible to legally remix songs on Apple Music or Spotify through theMixbank service provided by Dubset.

Read full topic

item.title: Remixing popular songs
item.dc:creator: Hiujier
item.description:
I’m pretty sure that you will not have any legal issues, if you do not monetize anything that has to do with the remix. There are plenty of uploads of songs that are on youtube, but are not monetized. This is because, if you do not have a large follower base and you don’t get a lot of money through it, the artist will probably just not care at all. but don’t take my advice, i’m a NOT lawyer ¯_(ツ)_/¯

Read full topic

item.title: Remixing popular songs
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
You could take a look at Tracklib.

Tracklib

Tracklib - the world’s first record store with songs for sampling.

Tracklib is a new crate digging and sampling service where every single song can be licensed for release within minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Remixing popular songs
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
wouldn’t recommend it. Big artists/labels tend to be pretty tight when it comes to remixes. And SoundCloud is the worst when it comes to that stuff too. They almost always side with the original creator/label

YouTube is a bit more lenient with that stuff tho.

Read full topic

item.title: Remixing popular songs
item.dc:creator: NightOwl
item.description:
You can if cpurse create the remix, but uploading it anywhere could become an issue. I guess you could try sending it to promotion YouTube channels and seeing if they’ll post it for you but I mean there’s no guarantee that that will work out for you either

Read full topic

item.title: Remixing popular songs
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
You can have legal issues.
It’s never safe to do a bootleg of anything.

Read full topic
